text: Herman Charles Bosman (5 February 1905 – 14 October 1951) was a South Africa short-story writer. He studied the works of Edgar Allan Poe and Mark Twain. His English-language works were mainly about Afrikaner characters, some were controversial. He was born in Cape Town. Bosman died on 14 October 1951 from a heart attack in Edenvale, South Africa at the age of 46. ==References== ==Other websites== *The Herman Charles Bosman Literary Society *City of Johannesburg Bosman page * Snyman, Salomé.
